title: Easy Apple Cinnamon Cake Recipe
full_text:
Easy Apple Cinnamon Cake Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
45 mins
Active
15 mins
Cooling Time
35 mins
Total
90 mins
Makes
1 cake
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
For Cake:
12
tablespoons
(
6
ounces
)
unsalted butter
, very soft
3/4
cup
(
5 1/4
ounce
)
granulated sugar
1/2
teaspoon
salt
2
large eggs
1/2
cup
plain yogurt
1/2
cup
applesauce
1 3/4
cup
(
8 3/4
ounces
)
all purpose flour
2
teaspoons
baking powder
1/2
teaspoon
ground cinnamon
1
pound
Cortland, Macintosh, or
Gala
baking
apples
(about
4
apples
), peeled, cored, sliced into 1/4-inch wedges
For Topping:
2
tablespoons
butter
, very soft (see note)
2
tablespoons
granulated sugar
1/2
teaspoon
ground cinnamon
Directions
Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
Whisk butter, sugar, and salt in a large bowl until creamy. Whisk in eggs, one by one, then yogurt and applesauce until combined.
Add flour, baking powder, and cinnamon to bowl and stir with whisk until just combined. Spread batter into pan and smooth the top.
Fan apples out on top of batter. Brush softened butter on top of apples. In the same unwashed bowl that contained the batter, combine the sugar and cinnamon for the topping and sprinkle over apples.
Bake until edges are golden, apples have softened and center is just set, 40 to 45 minutes. Transfer to wire rack to cool in pan 20 minutes, then remove sides of pan to cool.
Special equipment
9-inch springform pan
Layer Cake
North American
Baked Fruit
Apple
Fall Desserts
